patient_info: Proteinuria,Glomerulonephritis,Hearing impairment,Visual loss,Fever,Hypercholesterolemia,Elevated circulating creatinine concentration,Elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate,Recurrent tonsillitis,Abnormal urinary color,Macroscopic hematuria
golden_diagnosis: Alport syndrome, X-linked,Alport syndrome 2, autosomal recessive,Alport syndrome 3, autosomal dominant,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Alport syndrome
2. Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN)
3. Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS)
4. Idiopathic nephrotic syndrome (INS)
5. Primary membranous nephropathy (PMN)
6. Secondary membranous nephropathy (SMN)
7. Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)
8. Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody (ANCA) associated vasculitis
9. Henoch-Schönlein purpura (HSP)
10. Acute tubular necrosis (ATN)

Please note that this list is not exhaustive, and further evaluation and testing will be necessary to narrow down the diagnosis. The presented phenotype contains symptoms that could be associated with various renal and systemic disorders, which is why it is important to consider a broad range of possibilities. The top 10 diagnoses listed above cover both genetic and acquired conditions, as well as glomerular and tubulointerstitial disorders.
